text: (upbeat music)
- [Narrator] We are Sorted,
a group of mates who have your back
when it comes to all things food
from cooking battles, to gadget reviews,

and cookbook challenges, to
a mid-week meal packs app.
- [Audio recording] Crack your eggs and bake.
- [Narrator] We uncover the tools

that will help us all
cook and eat smarter.
Join our community,
where everything we do starts with you.
(whooshing)
(Christmas music)
- Hello, welcome to "Sorted".

- James, why is Christmas
our favourite time of year?

- So today we have Barry,

- When did I go that crown?

- When you buy Manuka
honey in a weekly shop.

small little gold rimmed
boxes full of delights.
- Eggnog Truffles.
I don't really understand.
Eggnog's a drink, isn't it?
An alcoholic Christmas-y festive drink.
(Ben sniffing)

- I think you could get
drunk off sniffing 'em.
They look like little snowballs.

- These are Eggnog Truffles
by Charbonnel et Walker,
sold in this case by Harvey Nichols.

These rich and creamy
white chocolate truffles
pack a generous wallop of Brandy
and a Christmasy grating of nutmeg,
making them a stunning present
and a very merry accompaniment
to festive tea and tipples.

that came in my stocking.

What's in eggnog that makes it yellow?
- Eggs.
(laughing)
- Hmm.
- That is very pleasurable.
- Sometimes white chocolate as a truffle
can be very sweet and rich.
This is that,
but with the kind of warming spices,
like the nutmeg and the brandy
that it kind of mellows it out.
It's good, it's a good pairing.
It's super tasty.
- Where do you think these play a role
in the Christmas festivities?

- So I think these have
the place of sitting there
to look opulent
and indulgent
and festive.
But nobody dares have one,
because there's only a handful.

- You'd either bring

is that Charbonnel et Walker

and they were one of Britain's

They have a Royal warrant,

so they have served many

very distinguished and
drenched in history.
- Their champagne truffles are excellent.
- Are they?
- Yeah.
- Now who's the pretentious king?

stocking from my granny.

- Wait a second.
- I'm out numbered.
(laughing)
That box weights 115 grammes,
you get 10 truffles inside.
Do you want to take a guess
as to how much these were purchased for?
- A good chocolate truffle
you can pay a couple of quid a pop.

20 pounds... is a lot for a
very small box of truffles,

but they are quality truffles
and they have a Royal seal.
So I'm going to go with 19.95.

- I'm gonna go bold and
say 2 pound a truffle,
so 20 quid.
- Ebbers, your Christmas has come early

(bell ringing)
- There you go.
- Would you buy it?

- Well then I'd buy one to

- It's very expensive.
- It's quite expensive.
- But I've never seen anything else

So it's quite unique.

- Do you think they

- For me, what I've done there
is they've taken two very simple things,

truffle and eggnog that
aren't pretentious,

but by put them together
in that packaging,

at that price tag, for me
that is now pretentious.
- This is where I'm going to struggle
with pretentious ingredients at Christmas,

because I think Christmas is
the most pretentious holiday.

It is a holiday for gifting
and we all buy into that.
And I want these in my home at Christmas.

(Christmas music)

- Pitch and lift, all

This is a Fortnum & Mason Christmas Coal.
- But I've been a good boy this year.

- And then something grabbed at

That's what I love about Christmas.
All the novelty... providing it delivers.

- This is Fortnum &
Mason's Christmas Coal,

cinder toffee dipped in
smooth milk chocolate
and covered in black lemon sherbet
for a deliciously distinctive flavour.

Our coal is made with
seasonal local honey,
when it is available.
- That sounds phenomenal.

- It's a very pretty piece of coal.
It's really light.
I had no idea that this was toffee.
(upbeat Christmasy music)
- That is giving me fireworks in my mouth.
That is very exciting.
- What you're seeing, what you're tasting,
and what you're experiencing
don't go together.
- Interesting.
- But because it's Christmas,
because it's ridiculous,
it's really enjoyable.

- And it looks like it's
actually leaving some

charcoal residue on your
fingers, like proper coal.
- Yeah, the sherbet goes everywhere.
- That's really good.
- That is amazing.
You get like a deep burny caramel,
which is delicious,
chocolate completely used to that flavour.

But then this sort of
citrusy sherbety fizz.

- The balance of flavour
is really excellent,
the balance of different components.
So you get enough chocolate,
you get enough sherbet,
and then the honeycomb just disappears.

It doesn't stick to
your teeth or anything.
- No, it's gone.
- It's great honeycomb.
Like a good Christmas film,
it's a story

and it's got something
about it that draws you in
and then surprises you.
If I was hosting,

I'd probably buy these almost
like a favour at a wedding.
It's that kind of experience

people to go on that too.

Would you like to let us

- 12 quid.
- It's gonna have to be a similar price

- You're a very generous man.
Reasonable?

- Yes.

Because where else are

- I know we're in a
pretentious ingredients format,

so I know these are going
to be relatively expensive,
but I don't think that's too expensive

- Is it pretentious?
- Yes.

- Right?
- What?
- Based on my last theory,
you take honeycomb, not pretentious.
You take coal, definitely not pretentious.

You put them together, put
a high price tag on it.
It's pretentious.

it's not coal,

I don't think that's pretentious.

- I'm not too familiar with this.
Is it port?
- Something fortified?

but given it's Christmas,
I'm gonna say sherry.

What a nose you have.

- That was gonna lead to my next question,

is that is sherry just

because I'm going to say right now,

I love a sherry especially
on Christmas day.
- I don't think I've tried it.
I think it's one of those things

- I won't like it, it's
far too grown up for me.

Pedro Ximenez Viejo VORS Sherry.

An extraordinarily intense,
profound, sweet, sticky
Pedro Ximenez Sherry from Gonzalez Byass.

have to shake it out of the bottle.

- I'm a dad now, maybe
I should like sherry.

instead of the traditional cognac and rum.

Marcona almonds with a ring
of cherries adorn the top,

while rings of oranges
decorate the delicious sides.

A very festive Fortnum's take
on the tempting tradition.
